item.title: Python and R
item.description: This is a Guide on how to use Python and R together. First letâ€™s discuss some simple Python coding Printing/Displaying items in Python This is done using a print() command print("Hello World") ## Hello World Assigning values in Python This is done using an = operator a = "Hello World " b= 5 print (a*b) #this will print a five times ## Hello World Hello World Hello World Hello World Hello World Working with lists in Python A python list is creates using square brackets- [].

item.title: Project 1
item.description: Introduction I decided to work with two Marvel datasets because I am a huge Marvel fan. I have watched all the Marvel movies at least 3 times and have also read a lot of the Marvel comic books. Through this projct I wanted to see if I can find any associations through the datasets I have chosen. For this Project, I will be analyzing 2 different Marvel datasets. The first dataset, called stats, has information on abilities of each of the Marvel Characters, such as intelligence, strength, power, and speed.

item.title: Project 2
item.description: Introduction For this project, I will be using the Titanic dataset. I am interested to see if I can see some relationship between survivial rate and other factors such as class, gender, and age. This dataset has 14 variables. The variable pclass states the passenger class, which can be 1,2, or 3. The variable sibsp is the number of siblings/spouses the person on board and the variable parch is the number of parents/children on board.
